channel.title: Gardens on Gardens of the Roman Empire
channel.description: Recent content in Gardens on Gardens of the Roman Empire

item.title: Bancroft *Rural Villa*
item.description: Province Britannia Location Camulodunum Location Description Camulodunum began as an Iron Age settlement defended by dykes, a combination of V-shaped ditch and rampart created by the upcast earth. It extended from the Roman river on the south to the Colne on the north, a distance of some four kilometers. Within this larger area, a legionary fort was built after the Claudian conquest of Britain in AD 43. On the site of the fort, a veteran colony was planted in about AD 49 and given the name Colonia Victricensis, City of Victory.
